title: How to Make Colored Sugar

methods.name: Using a Blender or Processor to Color Sugar

steps.headline: Measure and add a cup of sugar to a food processor or a blender.
Add a few drops of the food coloring of your choice to the food processor or a blender.
steps.description: The less drops you add, the lighter the colored sugar will be. The more drops added, the darker it will be.

steps.headline: Blend the ingredients to a desired texture and color.
steps.description: The food processor or blender also blends and breaks down the sugar into a finer grain, which is better for decorating.

steps.headline: Use the mixture immediately or store any leftovers in an airtight container.

methods.name: Using a Plastic Bag to Color Sugar

steps.headline: Add 1 cup of sugar to a resealable bag.
steps.description: The bag must be at least sandwich size.

steps.headline: Add in 2 to 3 drops of food coloring.
steps.description: Add the drops one at a time.

steps.headline: Shake the bag well.
steps.description: This will coat the sugar with the food dye.

steps.headline: Add more coloring if needed.
steps.description: Lumps can be crushed out with your hand.

steps.headline: Use as required.
steps.description: If not using immediately, ensure that the sugar is properly dried, then add to an airtight storage container.
